text:
I can power my house for the entire year in the Northern US with roof mounted solar panels (free nuclear energy) and get money back from the power company for everything I generate at 100% rate. 

Return on Investment is 7-10 years depending, and the panels will generate power for probably 30+ years beyond that.

With an electric vehicle, I will no longer require petrol. I will generate 100%+++ of my personal energy needs. Technology is here folks.

author: Drive X

text:
I rent a government provided one bedroom flat from Dundee City Council in Scotland. It is a four in a block flat. I am not permitted to install solar panels or a wind turbine on the property because of government rules and regulations. This is one reflection of how electricity supply is monopolised by government departments.

I payed 35p overnight charges. As of April 1st this charge increased to a 60p overnight charge. An increase of 25p per night. The hourly rate has also increased from 30p to nearer 54p.

If my calculations are correct (there are roughly 70,000 households in Dundee City) and this price increase took place across the entirety of the city, the electricity provider SSE have increased their profits by ¬£17,500 per night. That is a staggering ¬£6,387,500 per annum of an increase.

Why do SSE suddenly need an extra ¬£6,387,500 per annum?

¬£91 is a substantial amount more for a single resident to pay per annum for electricity charges.

¬£91 per annum for not using electricity? It is a mini scandal enacted via government provision for the poor and destitute. 

I may have to buy a caravan battery to provide electricity for living because not only can I not afford these higher electricity prices I don‚Äôt want to be of use to encourage a system that is of robbery.

I am being made complicit to the workings of a system that robs.
author: Lee Morris

author: Moon Man

text:
To be honest, I don‚Äôt think that is quite as daft a suggestion as some may think. Although it may be an unrealistic amount of effort to try and run a home for a family of four using a cycle generator.  It isn‚Äôt so far fetched to consider the possibility of exercise to provide a majority of your personal electricity consumption.  
Like many, this sudden price hike has forced me to evaluate exactly how much electricity is being used by which devices and I was shocked to see how little electricity I actually use.  Even working from home, I found that in a week, the per unit cost of the electricity use only just passes the equivalent of the standing charge of a single day. Using a decent cycle powered generator to charge a managed storage battery, even as little as two hours of moderate exercise a day would generate more than enough electricity to keep my home powered.
author: Ay Vee

text: ¬†@‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç¬† this would depend on the dynamo generator used.  A generator like the Sinewave Cycles Revolution USB Dynamo Powered Charging Device allows a phone to be charged by a cycle in around the same timeframe as charging the same phone using a charger plugged into an electrical outlet.
